titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Stuart Saunders Smith papers ARCH174
titlestmt.author: Written by Joseph Spence, 2019.

publicationstmt.publisher: University of Hartford Archives & Special Collections

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2019-10-11 12:53:39 -0400.

repository.corpname: University of Hartford Archives & Special Collections

did.abstract: This collection holds the personal and professional papers of Stuart Saunders Smith including compositions, recordings, correspondence, writings, and photographs.
did.langmaterial: The collection is primarily in English, with a small number of items in German.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The majority of the collection is open to all researchers. Only materials in the Restricted series are closed to researchers. A portion of the restricted materials will remain closed only during the lifetime of Stuart Saunders Smith, while original copies of redacted records will remain closed to researchers and available only to Archives' staff.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The materials in this collection may be protected by copyright law (U.S. Code: Title 17). Any use of the material which exceeds fair use requires permission from the copyright holder. Researchers are solely responsible for obtaining the proper permission(s) for their use of the material.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection houses the personal and professional papers of Stuart Saunders Smith from the beginning of his career in 1960 to the present (last additions to the collection were in 2018). The most extensive parts of this collection are Smith's compositions, recordings, and correspondence. Photographs, awards, programs, publicity materials, and writings are also included in the collection. All of which reveal the nature of Smith's professional career, family life as a father and son, and the various intersections therein.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged in eight series: I. Compositions, 1967-2018; II. Recordings, 1970-2018; III. Correspondence, 1975-2018; IV. Writings, 1974-2018; V. Subject Files, 1960-2018; VI. Photographs, Circa 1990-1997; VII. Restricted; VIII. Duplicates.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series consists primarily of Stuart Saunders Smith's compositions throughout the breadth of his career (1970-2018), as well as some compositions of others (mostly friends and colleagues) that he acquired via correspondence.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The series is arranged into two sub-series: a. Compositions by Stuart Saunders Smith and b. Compositions by Others.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This sub-series contains the compositions written by Stuart Saunders Smith throughout the breadth of his career (1970-2018). While Smith is known mostly for his works written for percussion, the compositions in this collection vary in instrumentation from works for solo piano, to an oratorio for orchestra and chorus, to pieces featuring short wave radios. Many of these works are held in various stages of completion, from the engraved (computer written) and published, to handwritten working papers (drafts of compositions and their program notes) and pieces withdrawn from his catalog. While the series does contain engraved and published copies, the majority of the compositions held within the series are handwritten manuscripts. His works also vary in examples of notation featuring text-only compositions, as well as graphic and indeterminate scores.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The compositions in this sub-series are arranged chronologically.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This sub-series contains the compositions of Stuart Saunders Smith's colleagues. Most of the works included within were acquired via correspondence and include original manuscripts and engraved copies.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The compositions in this sub-series are arranged chronologically.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Within this series is a varied collection of recordings of Stuart Saunders Smith's compositions. Several of the recordings are released albums that feature Smith's works, as well as albums on which a work of his was included. Several of the artists on the album are world-renowned ensembles and musicians such as: So Percussion, McCormick Percussion Ensemble, Bert Turetzky, Kyle Adam Blair, and Berndt Thurner. While there are many published albums in the collection, a great deal of the pieces are live recordings of concerts of Smith's works, recorded rehearsals, and some rough mixes of studio recordings. The vast majority of the recordings in the collection are CD's, though there are various audiocassettes, LP's, and quarter-inch audio reels, in addition to several video formats (DVD and VHS). There are also several recordings of works by Smith's friends and colleagues (which oftentimes were acquired via correspondence).

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The Recordings series is arranged into two sub-series: a. Recordings of Smith and his works and b. Recordings of others.

did.unittitle: Recordings of Smith and his works

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This sub-series contains recordings that feature at least one performance and/or composition by Stuart Saunders Smith. Included within the sub-series are professionally mixed and released albums, recorded concerts, rehearsals, as well as run-throughs of works and in-progress mixes of compositions to be released on albums.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This file consists of only drafts of linear notes for a recording "Percussion in Chamber Music," by The World (Inc.) Music Ensemble, a group of Hartford Area Composers and performers which, among others, included Stuart Saunders Smith, David Macbride, and Ed Diemente. The recording itself is not part of the collection.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Master recording of Pinetop, performed by Paul Hoffmann (pianist).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Master recording of Music By Stuart Smith, includes Songs I-IX , Poems I, II, and III , and Tit for Tat .
Performed by Stuart Smith (vocals), Arthur Steinhorn (brake drums), Stuart Smith (narrator).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: By Language Embellished by Stuart Saunders Smith. 16-bit Resolution Betacam Master.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Songs I-IX by Stuart Saunders Smith. Performed by Matt Fox at Kent State Stark Campus on April 15, 1994 and Ashland University April 28th, 1994. Cassette removed from correspondance to Stuart Saunders Smith from Mark Maynor dated May 20, 1994.

physdesc.physfacet: Two DAT Tapes labeled as "original master," DAT tape 1: Links 1-9, DAT Tape 2: Links 10 & 11. One Audiocassette labelled "The Links Series/ By Stuart Saunders Smith, Performed at the University of Akron, Side A: Links 8-11" [unclear is there is a Side B]. It is not been confirmed, but based on the dates and markings, it appears the DAT tapes are the master copies of the University of Akron performance, and the audio cassette is a dub copy of Links 8-11.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: File contains recordings of The Links Series (includes Links 1-11) performed by the University of Akron on May 2, 1995.

physdesc.physfacet: VHS T-120, Tapes 1 and 2, Tape 2 has a duplicate. Duplicates are labeled as Nov 6-7.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Stuart Saunders Smith Retrospective Tapes 1-2. October 6-7, 1995.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Only rare recordings were kept in this sub-series. Recordings which did not include compositions by Smith and are widely available at other libraries were removed from the collection. The removed recordings were recorded on a spreadsheet. The spreadsheet is currently retained in the Stuart Saunders Smith papers' collection/processing files and is available to patrons upon request.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This sub-series contains recorded performances of compositions that were not written by Stuart Saunders Smith. Many of these were acquired via correspondence between Smith and his colleagues and include professionally mixed and released albums, as well as recorded concerts in both audio and video mediums.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series primarily contains correspondence received by Stuart Saunders Smith, as well as some copies and drafts of letters he has sent. Many of the letters within this series are professional correspondences from colleagues regarding performances of his compositions and the commissioning of new compositions. There are also several letters from his family throughout his life. Some entries of note include correspondence with Brian Ferneyhough, letters from Berndt Thurner in which they discuss the preparations for a tour in Vienna that would feature Smith's works, and early correspondence between Smith and John Cage.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The series is in chronological order.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series consists of both published and unpublished writings either written and/or edited by Stuart Saunders Smith, or obtained by Smith from his colleagues and friends.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The series is arranged into two sub-series: a. Writings by Stuart Saunders Smith and b. Writings by Others.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This sub-series contains a wide variety of writings, both scholarly and personal, authored or edited by Stuart Saunders Smith. Smith's published writings range from treatises on graphic notation, percussion, and the nature of music itself, to an interview with John Cage. The series also includes Smith's poetry, which he has written throughout his life, including periodicals that feature his works, as well as poems from his youth bound in delicate notebooks. Other personal writings include memo notebooks, loose leaf manuscripts of program notes, journal articles, and poems (or as he refers to them, "speech songs").

did.unittitle: Scenarios; "Return and recall" and "Initiatives and Reactions"
Scores: An Anthology of New Music
Words and Spaces: An Anthology of Twentieth Century Musical Experiments in Language and Sonic Environments
Being Composed by the Snare Drum
The Geography of Time on Interpretation
Graphic Scores: Musical Notation as Visual Art
Thinking On Tools Touching My Trade

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This sub-series features many scholarly articles and dissertations written by others regarding Smith and his compositions. These include published periodicals as well as books. There are also publications and other writings he acquired via correspondence and friendship (some of which include personal inscriptions) that do not reference him or his work.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Only rare or inscribed books were kept in this sub-series. Most publications which were not written by Smith and were considered widely available at other libraries were removed from the collection. The removed publications were recorded on a spreadsheet. The spreadsheet is currently retained in the Stuart Saunders Smith papers' collection/processing files and is available to patrons upon request.

did.unittitle: Writings about Music, by Steve Reich
Andrew Hudson: A Glimpse Behind The Canvas
Grand River Suite by Robie Liscomb
New Instrumentation and Orchestration: An Outline for Study, by Larry Polansky
did.physdesc: Includes signed inscription by the author.

did.unittitle: Journal of New Music Research Reprint
Winnicott's Potential Space in Music and Dance
On the Nature of Percussion Masterworks
An Isn't Being An Is: Phenomenologies of Silence in the Music of Stuart Saunders Smith
The Memory of a Previous Now: Between Uttering and Executing
Grotowski/Brook/Mamet: Theory and Practice for the Actor-Percussionist, by Bill Sallak
Around the Alamo: The Making of Smith Publications
From Musical Ideas to Computers and Back
Playing Polyrhythms on the Guitar; Closing (after Goya)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains various personal and professional subject files retained by Stuart Saunders Smith, some as early as his childhood until 2018. The largest portions of the series are the publicity and programs files. Other notable files include the awards, childhood documents, contracts, and royalties files.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The series is arranged alphabetically by file name.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This file contains the various awards given to Stuart Saunders Smith. Included are his degrees from the University of Hartford, the grants awarded to him from the State of Maryland for his various residencies, and awards from the Percussive Arts Society.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This file features many of the various programs that have featured Stuart Saunders Smith's compositions in concerts held around the world. These programs span throughout Smith's life and career. The file features several programs from Smith's doctoral tenure at the University of Illinois, as well as international premieres by world-renowned ensembles and musicians such as So Percussion, Bert Turetzky, Kyle Adam Blair, and Carrie Rose. Many of the aforementioned musicians have been champions of Smith's music and appear multiple times throughout the file. The majority of the programs take place at the University of Maryland, Baltimore County (UMBC) and the University of Akron (Smith was a professor at both), in addition to the surrounding areas for each. Smith's music has also been featured at several musical festivals, most commonly appearing on programs for the Percussive Arts Society's International Convention (PASIC).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This file includes various publicity materials including posters, postcards, and news clippings that advertise, feature, or review Stuart Saunders Smith, his compositions, and the various recordings that feature them. The file includes press clips from Smith's performances as a drummer in his high school jazz band as well as posters advertising world premieres throughout the United States and internationally.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series consists of photographs of Stuart Saunders Smith (including portraits, candid, and performance photographs), as well as some personal photographs of Smith's friends and family.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Consists of print photographs of Stuart Saunders Smith, as well as two CDs of digital images of Smith.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This series contains restricted materials. Some files are inaccessible only during the lifetime of Stuart Saunders Smith. Others are permanently restricted and only accessible to Archives' staff (in these cases redacted versions are available to all researchers in other series).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains duplicate copies of materials in the collection.
